intro: Galium laeve, commonly known as smooth bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, often fragrant flowers. The plant features slender, ascending stems that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. Its small white or pinkish flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom in early summer. Galium laeve is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
